text:
Generative Artificial Intelligence is
creating a future where AI

will impact humans in ways
we can only imagine today.
I'm James Landay,

Professor of Computer Science
at Stanford.

I'm also the Co-founder
and Vice Director

of the Stanford Institute
for Human Centered

Artificial Intelligence,
or HAI.

I'm here to welcome you
to our program on Generative AI
and Foundation Models.
At HAI, we believe that AI

technology should be inspired
by human intelligence.
The development of AI

must be guided
by its impact on humans,
and applications of AI

should enhance and augment humans,
not replace them.

In this program,
we'll explore generative AI

from a diverse set of expert
perspectives.

One of the most exciting AI
technical trends

is the rise of
Agentic AI.

This won't be your typical
online

course covering the topic
from A to Z.

Instead, we've invited
the most renowned

faculty and instructors
at Stanford University

to give you a truly
unique learning experience.

I’d like to talk to you today
about what I call
The AI Awakening.
They'll share their

cutting edge
research and insights,

allowing you to delve
deep into the

ever evolving
landscape of generative AI.

The simplest form of a 
machine learning system

is a supervised learning
system.

They’ll touch on 
technical aspects,
real-world examples,
ethical considerations,

and the pivotal role of 
human-centric design.

In addition to designing
out of need,

what if we designed out of
human values?

We’ve divided our journey
into three individual courses.

You'll be exploring topics
like technical fundamentals,

how foundation models
can be applied in different

business fields, and emphasis
on human-centered design.

Together, we'll navigate
the evolving landscape

of generative AI,
demonstrating

how and where human
values will lead the way.
